page.title: 04THE CASTLE 2
page.content: restored and added to in the 19th century. During the Civil war, the castle was first held by Thomas Luttrell against the Royalists who took control of it in 1642. The Parliamentary troops took over the castle again after a six month siege and in 1650, an order was made to pull down the fortifications. Before all the fortifications were pulled down, the Luttrell family paid a fine which allowed them to go back and live in the castle. About this time the stables were rebuilt after being damaged during the Civil War. In 1949 a Property Company bought the castle but allowed Geoffrey Luttrell to live there. In 1954 the Crown Commissioners offered to sell the land back to the Luttrells. In 1976 the castle and 30 acres of parkland were presented to the National Trust.
